alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 15 at 5:41AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN LIKELY FOR BRISTOL BAY TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... An unseasonably warm storm will move through Bristol Bay tonight into Wednesday morning producing widespread heavy rainfall to the region. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain is expected to fall from 6pm Tuesday to 9 am Wednesday. Rainfall rates are expected to be the highest between 9pm and 2am. All areas below approximately 3000 ft in elevation will receive rain, including areas well into the interior. Ponding of water on roadways and poor drainage areas is likely. Overflow of water on rivers is possible due to the rapid introduction of water into the hydrologic system and increased load on existing frozen waterways. Metal roofs, particularly those of A-frame construction or steep slopes are likely to shed existing snow, which may pose a hazard.
